# Backend AI SDK - Quick Start Guide

**Get your Express.js backend AI-ready in 5 minutes!**

## üìã Prerequisites

Before you begin, you need:

1. **From Backend AI Administrator:**
   - ‚úÖ Tenant ID (e.g., `tenant_yourcompany`)
   - ‚úÖ Core Service URL (e.g., `backend-ai.yourcompany.com:50051`)

2. **You need to obtain:**
   - üîë Gemini API Key - [Get it here](https://makersuite.google.com/app/apikey)

3. **Your environment:**
   - Express.js v4.x or v5.x
   - Node.js 18+

---

## 1Ô∏è‚É£ Install

```bash
npm install @backend-ai/sdk-express
```

## 2Ô∏è‚É£ Configure

Create `.env` in your project root:
```bash
# Get your Gemini API key from: https://makersuite.google.com/app/apikey
GEMINI_API_KEY=your_gemini_api_key_here

# Backend AI Core URL (provided by your Backend AI administrator)
CORE_URL=localhost:50051
```

## 3Ô∏è‚É£ Add to Your App

```javascript
const { BackendAI } = require('@backend-ai/sdk-express');
require('dotenv').config();

// ... your existing routes ...

// Add this before app.listen()
(async () => {
  await BackendAI.init(app, {
    adapterId: 'my-backend',              // Choose a unique name for your app
    tenantId: 'YOUR_TENANT_ID',           // Provided by Backend AI admin
    coreUrl: process.env.CORE_URL,        // From .env file
  });

  app.listen(3000);
})();
```

## 4Ô∏è‚É£ Run

```bash
npm start
```

## ‚úÖ Done!

You should see:
```
‚úÖ Registered X tools with Core
üß© SDK Executor running on port 6000
```

Your APIs are now AI-accessible!

---

## üìñ Full Guide

See [INTEGRATION_GUIDE.md](./INTEGRATION_GUIDE.md) for complete documentation.

## ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration Options

```javascript
{
  // REQUIRED - Get from Backend AI admin
  tenantId: 'YOUR_TENANT_ID',           // Your organization's tenant ID
  coreUrl: 'localhost:50051',           // Backend AI Core service URL
  
  // REQUIRED - Choose yourself
  adapterId: 'my-backend-api',          // Unique identifier for your app
  
  // OPTIONAL
  executorPort: 6000,                   // gRPC executor port (default: 6000)
  verbose: true,                        // Enable detailed logging (default: false)
  geminiApiKey: process.env.GEMINI_API_KEY,  // Uses GEMINI_API_KEY env var if not provided
}
```

## üêõ Troubleshooting

| Issue | Fix |
|-------|-----|
| No routes discovered | Call `BackendAI.init()` **after** defining routes |
| Port 6000 in use | Set `executorPort: 6001` |
| Core connection failed | Check `CORE_URL` in .env |
| Missing Gemini key | Add `GEMINI_API_KEY` to .env |

## üîí Security Notes

- Executor port (6000) should **not** be public
- Only Core service should access it
- Your auth middleware still works for HTTP requests

## üìû Need Help?

Contact your Backend AI administrator or see the full integration guide.
